statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: Southern Conference Men's Championship - 1st Round AT CHARLE

article.headline: Wofford 58, W. Carolina 49
article.story: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Noah Dahlman had 16 points and Corey Godzinski 13 as Wofford advanced in the Southern Conference tournament with a 58-49 victory over Western Carolina on Friday. Next up for the eighth-seeded Terriers (16-15) is No. 1 seed Davidson, which went 20-0 in league play this season, in Saturday's quarterfinals. The Catamounts end the season at 10-21. Western Carolina trailed by two when Dahlman and Godzinski scored seven straight points. Dahlman started things with a bucket, while Godzinski's 3-pointer closed the spurt and give Wofford a 23-14 lead. The Catamounts came back in the second half to take a 38-36 lead after Negus McKenna's bucket with 10:30 to go. But the Terriers used another 7-0 run to take the lead for good. Western Carolina cut things to 49-47 with 3:35 left. Then Shane Nichols added a 3-pointer and Dahlman a layup to extend the lead for Wofford. Jake Robinson led the Catamounts with 14 points, while Blake Gallagher added 10 points.
